Banana Cake.Directions: Bake in three layer pans at 350 degrees.

Blueberry Coffee Cake.Directions: Mix butter, 1 cup sugar, flour, 2 eggs, 2 tsp vanilla, baking powder, and milk to make cake batter. Blend easily. Add 3 cups of blueberries. Put 2 1/2 cups of batter in pan. Mix cream cheese, 1/2 cup sugar, 1 egg, lemon juice and 1 tsp vanilla to make filling. Put filling on top of batter. Top with remaining batter. Make streusel topping from flour, butter, brown sugar, ad cinnamon. Sprinkle on top of cake. Bake at 375 degrees for 1 hour and 5 minutes. Check after 50 minutes.

Fresh Apple Cake.Directions: Mix apples and sugar well. Add oil, nuts, and eggs. Add vanilla and dry ingredients. Bake at 350 degrees for 40-45 minutes. Serve with whipped cream or top with cream cheese frosting.

Fresh Pear Cake.Directions: Butter and flour a 9 inch round pan. Peel and slice pears. Blend eggs, sugar, milk, and salt. Add flour, mix well. Fold 1/2 of pears into batter. Pour into pan, fan remaining pears on top. Dot with butter. Bake at 350 degrees about 55 minutes. Sprinkle with powdered sugar.

Lemon Poppy Cake.Directions: Mix all for 4 minutes. Bake at 350 degrees for 40 minutes.

Light Old Fashioned Fruit Cake.Directions: Sift dry ingredients into a 4 quart bowl. Add fruit and nuts. Mix until well coated. Set aside. Cream butter, gradually add sugar and cream until fluffy. Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each. Add brandy. Combine with fruit mixture. Mix well. Turn into a 10 inch tube pan or four 1# coffee cans lined with foil, filling pans 2/3 full. Bake in slow oven, 275 degrees for 2 3/4 to 3 hours. About 1/2 hour before done brush lightly with honey or light corn syrup. Cool completely then wrap tightly in foil to store for several weeks. Brush with brandy about once a week.

Spicy Fruit and Nut Cake*.Directions: Bake in greased and floured 9" bundt pan at 350 degrees for 45-50 minutes. Cool 15 minutes. Loosen around edges with thin spatula. Pierce with a wooden pick. Glaze directions: Cook glaze ingredients over medium heat until full boil and butter melts. Ladle glaze over cake.

Strawberry Spice Loaf.Directions: Bake in two 9" loaf pans, greased and floured, at 350 degrees for one hour.

Lemon Squares.Directions: Mix first 3 ingredients well. Press into 8"x8"x2" pan. Build up 1/2" edge. Bake 20 minutes at 350 degrees. Beat remaining 6 ingredients until light and fluffy. Pour over hot crust. Bake another 25 minutes. Cool. Dust with the powdered sugar. Cut into squares.

Oatmeal Cookies.Directions: Mix ingredients in the order given. Drop by teaspoonful onto a cookie sheet. Bake 8-10 minutes at 350 degrees.

Peanut Butter Cookies.Directions: Form into balls. Flatten with fork dipped in flour or sugar. Bake for 8 minutes at 375 degrees.

Dutch Apple Pie.Directions: Combine apples, 1/2 cup sugar, and cinnamon. Put into the unbaked pie shell. Top with 1/2 cup sugar, flour, butter, and cinnamon. Bake 45-50 minutes at 350 degrees.

Fresh Strawberry Pie.Directions: Slice 1 basket of strawberries. Put half the berries in the bottom of a baked pie shell. Prepare glaze by combining remaining ingredients and cooking in a double-boiler until thickened. Stir the other half of the berries into the glaze. Pour into the shell. Cool. Top with whipped cream and halved berries.

Lemon Cloud Pie.Directions: Combine in sauce pan 3/4 cup sugar, cornstarch, water, lemon rind, and juice, and slightly beaten egg yolk. Cook over medium heat stirring constantly until thick. Remove from heat. Add softened cheese, blend well. Cool. Beat egg whites until stiff. Add 1/4 sugar. Fold into lemon mixture. Spoon into crust. Chill 2 hours. Serve with whipped cream.

Five Bean Salad.Directions: Drain beans and stir together. Mix ingredients for dressing. Combine dressing and beans.

Green Bean Salad.Directions: Mix oil, vinegar, onion, and lemon. Pour over beans. Chill 3 hour or longer. Spoon beans onto lettuce with slotted spoon. Top with crumbled blue cheese and coarsely chopped walnuts

Lemon Cloud Salad.Directions: Set jello with 1/2 c. less water than package instructions. When partially set stir in Dream Whip. Add fruits. Set several hours to chill.

Spinach Salad.Directions: Mix spinach and thinly sliced onion. Fry bacon until crisp, drain. To drippings add vinegar, water, sugar, and salt. Bring to a boil. Beat egg until light. Add sour cream. Pour boiling liquid over egg then pour back in skillet. Cook over low heat until thick. Pour over spinach, add bacon and chopped egg. Toss lightly.

Spinach Salad with Avocado.Directions: Clean spinach. Tear for salad. Cut avocado in small pieces. Sprinkle with lemon. Slice onion as thin as possible. Combine spinach, avocado, onion, and oranges. Mix remaining ingredients to make dressing. Pour dressing over salad. Sprinkle on bacon bits.

Summer Fruit Salad.Directions: Combine all ingredients. Cover and chill several hours or overnight.

Broccoli Cheese Soup.Directions: Place potato, broccoli (reserve 2 cups), carrots, garlic, onion, salt, and water in large saucepan. Bring to boil, then simmer until all vegetables are very tender. Puree in blender or food processor, and transfer to kettle or dutch oven. Steam reserved broccoli pieces until just tender. Add to puree along with all remaining ingredients. Heat gently. Serve topped with additional grated cheddar cheese.

Chicken Noodle Soup.Directions: Boil chicken, remove from bones and chop. Set aside. Cook potato, carrots, celery, and onion in water to cover. When tender add the chicken, bouillon cubes, poultry seasoning, and salt. Add a large handful of narrow egg noodles. Add more liquid if necessary and cook until noodles are tender.

Creamy Zucchini Mushroom Soup.Directions: Combine zucchini, onion, garlic and butter in 2 qt. microwave-safe casserole. Cover and microwave on high setting 5 to 7 minutes, stirring every 3 minutes, until vegetables are tender. Place zucchini mixture in blender container; blend until smooth. Return to casserole dish; add all remaining ingredients except sour cream, pepper and pine nuts. Cover and microwave 5 to 6 minutes, or until heated through. Stir in sour cream and season to taste with pepper. Ladle into soup bowls and garnish with sprinkle of pine nuts. Serve immediately.
